page.title: 19A Farm near St.Albans.
page.content: {Shafford Farm}is within walking distance of our school.We reach it by walking through{woodland}and then past a field of{rape.} Earlier in the year the rape was a blanket of brilliant yellow flowers. Now the{pods}are growing and later the seeds will be{gathered}and{squeezed to extract{oil.}The{farmhouse}is now a private house,but part of the old farm is now used as{stabling}for horses,and much of the land is used for{grazing}for the horses and for growing{hay.}When the hay is ready, it is made into bales and{stored}in a {dutch barn. This year,}due to the {wet {spring,}the barn is not yet filled.{ {Barley,}a cereal crop,is also grown.It looks like a golden sea with ripples of wind.You can tell the barley from wheat as barley has long spiky whiskers.
